DEPLOYMENT: AWS, Docker (JUNE 2018).

ABOUT PROJECT

Designing a Game-Based learning platform, using a micro service based architecture. The aim was to implement the product as micro services so that each of them would be self-sufficient and independent of other services.

The product had three basic game modes that is, Single Player, Multi Player and an adaptive game mode. It was designed in such a fashion that new features and services could be added to the product without disturbing the existing services. In total we had 16 microservices, each functioning independent of each other and communicating via a message bus (Kafka).

Our main role was to experience a full end to end product starting from gathering requirements from the client to deployment on an AWS server, including designing architectural flow and writing test cases as well.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITES

To develop services in the product using Microservice Architecture.

Making a fully functioning, independent service with server-side and client-side code.

Identifying and implementing the appropriate databases required for the particular service.

Designing of client-side web pages in the application.

As Scrum master to update with the team.

Writing test cases for both the server and client-side services.

Hands on experience on Agile Methodologies

Implementing the User Profile service.

Handling the overall product client side look.

Responsiveness of all the web pages of product including other services.

Collecting every data after game is finished and reflecting it to user profile, hence showing his progress.

Dockerization of micro services.

Dockerization of databases and servers.

Writing Unit test cases for our service. Back end test cases used Junit and Mockito, and Front end test cases using Karma environment.

Integration of Back end to front end with sync to another service i.e. Login Service.



PROJECT NAME

FACTORY COMMAND AND CONTROL CENTER.

TECHNOLOGY USED

LANGUAGES:  .NET, Angular, Javascript, Web Services, Bootstrap.

DATABASES:  MySQL.

MONITORING TOOLS: JS-charts, amcharts, threejs.

PATTERNS: API Gateway.

DEPLOYMENT: DEC 2018.

ABOUT PROJECT

Enterprises leveraging advanced and predictive analytics today to provide greater insights and contextual intelligence into operations. FCCC here, is a successful attempt at combining analytics and human intervention. FCCC getting raw data from IOT device and converting it into formats that are intelligible. Further, it presents data interpretations to us through dashboards that not only allow us to understand the data but also take adequate actions where necessary.

Here are a few benefits of FCCC:

Real-time view into operational performance.

Accurate data and analysis that eliminates erroneous decisions.

Optimized resource utilization.

In-time interventions to ensure smooth functioning of operations.



It’s all about applying business intelligence to manufacturing data. A great FCCC platform brings innovation, customer centricity, operational excellence and agility to the table. It weaves together a wide range of technologies such that users get a holistic view of all factory operations. The platform must empower the users to take right actions by integrating external systems and facilitating live alerts. The solution should be fully customizable and extensible to meet any organization- or task-specific demands.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITES

Handling Login and Dashboard UI design of Product.

Converting the JSON data from machines into tabular forms and certain pie charts.

Exploring amcharts and threejs for more extensive.

Exploring Microsoft Power BI (kind of tabular or pie charts).

Creating animating backgrounds using threejs.

Designing of Admin Login and Landing page for the product.

Displaying dynamic data from a rest API on earthjs.

Displaying dynamic data from a rest API on amcharts.

Helping to create new UI designs as there was no UI designer in the initial phase.

Helping team members when issues arise majorly on front end side.

PearlOm Transformation Story:
PearlOm was a small Size company dealing in precious and semiprecious stone Jewellery with limited retail
presence in North Delhi, The vision was to take PearlOm brand online, however being a small company, it
did not really have the capex and marketing budget to build its own website and do digital marketing.
Instead of opening its own website, we took and innovative approach and partnered with other curated
market places who already had to strong visitor base. We became vendor partner and worked on Revenue
sharing model with these market places. The advantage was, PearlOm did not invest in customer
acquisition cost and was able to retain profits right from the beginning.
The company that had no revenue from online sales till October 2016 have closed FY 2018-19 with revenue
of Rs 30 Lacs plus and targeting Rs 50 Lacs in 2019 – 20. I was responsible for the complete project
conceptualization and execution.

documentation activities related therewith.

A keen analyst with active role in business operations providing legal, strategic and commercial advice in
evaluating new opportunities and analyzing current activities providing tactical business solutions.



Sound commercial and relationship management skills and abilities in liaising with affiliates, partners, banks,
financial institutions, regulatory authorities and other external agencies.



Expertise in conducting Board Meetings/Committee Meetings/General Meetings, Preparation of statutory
documents and returns, interacting with Statutory & Regulatory Authorities etc.



Well versed with the provisions of the Companies Act, Securities Contract (Regulation) Act, SEBI Act, SEBI
Take-over Code, FEMA, etc.

A result-oriented professional with expertise in drafting Agreements, Deeds, legal notices other corporate &
company law related documents and other ancillary and related works.

CORE COMPETENCIES
Secretarial & Legal Functions: Taking care of all the routine secretarial compliances, provide guidance for
establishment of corporate governance practices with on-time compliance. Ensure compliance of Company Law
matters and statutory provisions. Steer the conduct of meetings including those of the Board, Committee,
Shareholders, Debenture holders. Advise the Board on Government (Govt.) policies. Draft Collaboration
Agreements, Agenda, Minutes etc. Deal with Financial Institutions, Banks, State / Central Govts, Company Law
Board, ROC, Stock Exchanges, RBI. Facilitating Companies Act, SEBI, Stock Exchange Regulations, FEMA, SICA and
other allied laws in respect of various approvals, compliances, Corporate Structuring, Borrowings and Investments
etc. Formalities related to Amalgamation, acquisitions etc. Restatement of articles pursuant to private equity
infusion. Vetting and execution of Loan documents, mortgage deeds, hypothecations deeds, guarantee and pledge
documents, debenture trusteeship arrangements and other arrangement with Banks including Bank guarantee,
obtaining pari passu letters for charge, other NOC’s and agreements.
Public Issues/Pvt.Equity: Conduct Due Diligence for the Right Issues / Private Equity, Company Acquisition or
Takeover of companies. Pre-issue services including consultancy on Financial/Management restructuring,
finalisation of Project Reports, Intermediaries, Offer Document and Agreements. Restatement of accounts,
statutory compliances, financial & corporate restructuring. Instrumental in appointment of Registrar and Transfer

 Agent (RTA), Merchant Banker and other intermediaries. Experience in handling finalization of Term Sheet, Drafting
and confirmation of Shareholder’s and Share Subscription agreement for Private equity infusion.
Statutory Compliances: Liaising with Regulatory Authorities and Government Departments for obtaining
necessary sanctions / clearances & ensuring compliance with statutory obligations for a manufacturing company
with respect to Labor Employees, factory, environment, pollution board, safety etc.
Governance: Offering a strong internal control and corporate governance background and system, leading in
integrity and ethics matters to emphasize governance as a value-driver.
Corporate Consulting: Interfacing with regulatory and government bodies for rendering in-house advisory as well
as facilitating Incorporation of Companies, formation of Joint-Ventures, Licenses etc. Providing guidance for
establishment of corporate governance best practices with on-time compliance. Making presentations to
Management, Investors (private Equity, FII’s etc.) to create awareness about Legal Compliances and render
guidance on various Statutory Laws. Advising management regarding the legal impact of Bilateral / Multilateral
Laws and Regulations on Company & Partnership operations. Conducting Due Diligence exercises, and handling
assignments for statutory compliances under Central and Local Laws.
Strategic Financial Planning & Management: Supervising & Managing functions involving subsidy claims from
central and state government under various industrial promotional schemes and setting up ventures based on that.
Under a special assignment by the Management undertook a project for reducing the cost of power at factory, and
a Third party PPA done for the same after evaluation of various options of sourcing power. Corporate restructuring
based on financial objectives, designed Financial plans and systems, policies & procedures. Formulating budgets
and conducting variance analysis to determine difference between projected & actual results and implementing
corrective actions. Acting as an agent of change and reworking business/finance models to achieve organizational
and growth objectives; improving information systems to support strategic and operational management decisions.

CAREER CONTOUR



Served Vijeta Sharma & Associates, a practicing firm in Thane, Mumbai from December, 2013 till



Served Tulsi Castings and Machining Ltd. (TCML), Mumbai, a Manufacturing Company from 1st July,

It caters to OEM’s like Toyota, Honda, Hyundai, General Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra, Goodrej and other



WT_ARBD Affordable Refreshable Braille Display
Technology:
C, C++, Linux device drivers, ARM, BeagleBone_Green_Wireless
Detail: Refreshable Braille displays empower the blind and the deaf-blind with opportunities in education
and employment. Exorbitant cost of Braille cells has, however restricted their reach to less than 10% of
potential users and almost invisible in countries like India.All commercial Braille cells use piezoelectric
actuation. TacRead, a novel Braille cell technology developed at IIT Delhi, delivers the same functionality at
one-tenth the cost. The technology uses shape memory alloy actuation for which patents have been filed in
India and with WIPO. TacRead has been prototyped in our laboratory and has undergone limited user
testing.The proposal concerns translational research of TacRead which includes technology transfer, design
optimization for cost reduction, improving its robustness and development of Braille displays using TacRead
cells arrays.

build environment for the same.

Centralizing the Accrual Process in Shared Services for AstraZeneca
Roles and responsibility:


Business units enter their own accruals within specified dollar limits. Accruals over $500k need Controller approval,
and over $1M needs CFO approval. This is at a divisional level.



We currently allow business units/locations to enter their own accruals, as well as certain inventory related JEs,
directly into the financial system. However, we are in the process of transitioning the posting of these entries from the
business units to General Accounting so that General Accounting has the opportunity to review and approve the JEs
prior to posting to the general ledger as required by company policy. In those ERP systems that have the capability to
park JEs, we will rely on the parking functionality due to the volume of entries. For those systems that do not have
parking functionality, we will require the business units to submit the JEs to General Accounting for processing.



We have an internally automated accrual tool; many requests meet pre-set criteria and require no further review, but
some do require further review by G/L before final posting.



Regarding software, where units use the Ariba purchasing system, we use that to generate an accrual to be posted
to SAP. Otherwise SAP POs generate an accrual proposal. Judgmental accruals are submitted by units to General
Accounting in our SSCs.




Posting is centralized at Corporate Accounting based on information provided by outsourced Shared Services.
We have both a business and SSC accrual process. The SSC accrual is mainly about Accounts Payable and
employee expense, with business units performing department accruals. The SSC accrual needs the General
Accounting team’s review and the business accrual is posted directly.



Currently created and posted by other areas of Finance, although this is not necessarily the intention going forward.



Our staff accountants review the business unit financials and make accruals on their behalf. The individual business
unit does not make these decisions.



In our Global Financial Shared Services organization, we provide a “full service package” for the Business Units. This
means the Shared Service Center receives the details for posting the accruals into the ledger and makes the entry.

low-rise buildings. I am well-versed with regional and international codes and standards. My experience encompasses
all stages of development from concept through design project execution.
My current responsibilities cover red lining conceptual designs, system selections, product comparisons and

Refrigerant Flow).

consumption by 30%. The whole system modification was to meet MEW regulations.

interior spaces as per their functionality and comfort requirements.

general exhaust air.

pressurization system were provided in accordance with Kuwait fire department regulations.

CQM application is a centralized application for the all the companies and citizens. If there is a problem
faced by any citizen of the state, the citizen may log into the application and send his/her query to the
Commission and accordingly it would take action on the problem by creating a Case against that
company.
The “iGOVERN Complaint & Quality Management” is a web-based fully integrated, centralized and flexible
complaint and quality management solution providing all core business processes/ functionalities for the
key stakeholders in the ecosystem. Complaint & Quality Management provides an integrated case
management system designed to automate the entire lifecycle of a case – from the Initial Filing in a Case
up to Case Closure.
Prominent features of iGOVERN Complaint & Quality Management System are:
1. Single unified interface for all case related activities
2. Direct connect and collaboration between different stakeholders
3. Enable electronic storage and retrieval of all case related documents
4. Enable electronic filing of cases from within and outside department
5. Create case metadata as key reference record for the Staff to work upon, track and manage the
processes.
6. Enable administrator to seamlessly define workflow and business rules for cases.
7. Instant notifications/ reminders to appropriate recipient(s) for events and/or upcoming deadlines.
8. Content based search
9. Secured and Role based access

Q2 Solutions, the world’s second largest clinical trial laboratory services provider and is
managing more than 9 million laboratory tests annually for clinical trials and helping
biopharmaceutical, medical device and diagnostics customers improve human health
through innovation that transforms science and data into actionable medical insights.
Q2 Solutions offer end to end lab services across the development continuum through
their global laboratory network. It’s a combination of IQVIA’s global scale, clinical trial
expertise, and diverse therapeutic experience, scientific and quality excellence, supply
chain network, and informatics.
A Laboratory Trial Management System (LTMS) is a software system used by
biotechnology and pharmaceutical
industries to manage laboratory trials in clinical research.
The system maintains and manages planning, performing and reporting functions, along
with participant contact information, tracking deadlines and milestones.
A laboratory trial management system provides data to a business intelligence system,
which acts as a digital dashboard for trial managers. LTMS allow experts easily to access
centralized data and thus reducing the number of delayed trials.
